text.p: Shanghai's Planning Commission is considering expanding its subway system to 11 lines running a total of 430 km throughout the city, the Shanghai Star said on Friday.
The city's first 16 km line opened in April 1995 and construction of a second line, due to open partially in 1999, began recently.
The paper said the city government was considering a 30 km circular subway that would link the first two lines, and eight other lines were being discussed.
In addition, the city has started construction of a light rail line in a southwest suburb of the city and was considering six other lines, it said without elaborating.
Shanghai has largely financed the first two lines through foreign loans.
